cluster_relations.rel_desc: Eye contact is given as an example of body language in the discussion of its role in nonverbal communication.
remarks: Relation direction chosen as body language including eye contact as an example behavior.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Posture is treated as a specific aspect of body language that people can observe and be mindful of.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Implied by sequencing of posture and body language discussion

remarks: Semantics partly rely on domain knowledge that posture is a form of body language; text implies but does not state it explicitly.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject behavioral category is illustrated or exemplified by the object behavior.
args.justification: The relation describes body language being illustrated by an example behavior (eye contact) rather than a strict part-whole or subtype relation; a predicate focused on illustrative/example behavior captures this semantics best.
args.remark: Use this predicate when a communication/behavior category is being exemplified by a specific behavior.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a specific aspect, feature, or component of the broader phenomenon described by the object.
args.justification: The text and domain knowledge both support that posture is treated as a specific aspect or component of body language, so an aspect/part-style predicate is appropriate.
args.remark: Apply this where a specific nonverbal cue is framed as an aspect of a broader communication construct.

args.justification: This link connects a general behavior category (body language) to a specific behavior that serves as an illustrative example, which fits an illustrative/instance-style relation class.
args.remark: Covers cases where entities are linked as example instances used for explanation rather than strict taxonomy.

args.justification: The relation treats posture as a component/aspect of body language, which is a part-whole style relation specifically within nonverbal communication constructs.
args.remark: Use this for relations where specific nonverbal cues (e.g., posture, gestures) are modeled as components of broader nonverbal categories.

args.justification: The example relation associates a general category with an illustrative instance used in explanation; this is best captured as an associative/illustrative link rather than strict composition or identity.
Posture is modeled as a component/aspect of body language, which is a part-whole/structural relationship, fitting a broad COMPOSITION group.
